Italy's 'Meloni model' of fiscal discipline masks an illiberal shift
subhead: Since becoming Italian prime minister in 2022, Giorgia Meloni has become a model that the French right aspires to emulate, even though her supposed success is more narrative than reality, with Italy continuing to struggle with low productivity and rising poverty.

title: Macron and PM Lecornu keep low profiles amid social unrest
subhead: The silence from the top of the French state, as two waves of social protest erupted in eight days, gave opposition parties and labor unions free rein to challenge the prime minister and influence the agenda of his future government.

title: Belgian activists rally to prevent destruction of USAID contraceptive stocks
subhead: Despite efforts by Belgian authorities, the Trump administration has refused to allow the use or resale of contraceptives and antiretrovirals from the former United States Agency for International Development (USAID) that are currently stored in Belgium.

title: Towers of Notre-Dame de Paris reopen to the public
subhead: Nearly a year after the interior of the cathedral reopened, French President Emmanuel Macron was to inaugurate the final section on Friday, September 19.

title: Why prosecutors want PSG's Achraf Hakimi to stand trial for rape

title: Who is Gabriel Zucman, billionaires' nightmare?
subhead: Since Sébastien Lecornu's appointment as prime minister, Gabriel Zucman's name has been everywhere in French media. The economist's proposal for a 2% wealth tax on the ultra-rich has returned to the forefront of public debate.
